result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician. ...
4)Defendant shall take all medications as directed and prescribed by a medical professional or physician. 
5)Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
6)Defendant shall complete an AODA and Anger Management.....
7)Defendant shall complete 40 hours of community service within 6 months and provide documentation of completion to the PCDA.
8)Defendant must submit a written letter of apology to JMB and provide to PCDA...
9)One month prior to completion of this contract, Defendant must contact the Pepin County District Attorney...
10)Defendant must report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
11) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah G. LaPean

defendant.name: LaPean, Noah G.
defendant.address: W5433 CTH V Lot #1, Durand, WI 54736

records.addlTxt: 02:52 PM Defendant Noah G. LaPean appeared by video means with Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  We have an agreement of a DAGPA, a plea questionnaire has been filed.  The DAGPA is to count 1 with the conditions set forth therein.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Mr. Schroeder sentencing comments, his client is 17, has no prior criminal history and ask the court accept the agreement.  Court asks Mr. Seifert what will happen to the remaining counts in the complaint?  They would be DRI.  Court reviews the DAPGA contract with defendant.  Court advises defendant of count 1/max. penalties.  Plea colluqy.  Subject to the terms of the DAGP contract defendant pleads no contest.  Court accepts your plea and defer a finding of guilty for 1 year.  The remaining counts will be DRI.
Proposed Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or Non Contest Plea Agreement
Status conference on May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:22 PM Defendant Noah G. LaPean in court without counsel.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Schroeder was appointed.  Mr. Patek appearing with the PD office.  Mr. LaPean is subject to a signature bond and was in court on 3/22 and reviewed the charges.  Mr. Patek was asked by Attorney Schroeder to schedule for 5/3 and enter NGP at this time.  Defendant confirms his address on file W5433 County V Lot 1, Durand 54736.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:16 PM Defendant Noah G. LaPean appeared by video means from the Pepin County Jail with Attorney Schroeder by video means.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schroeder spoke with the social worker who is trying to get a hold of grandma to get her on the line as understand the State will be asking for $500 cash bond.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  State is familiar with Mr. LaPean regarding his juvenile record and concerned with not only battery to person who is is grandmother in the same location he's living and count 3 allegation of resisting an officer and willing to defy authorities.  State interested in what the alleged victim says and believe he should be on a cash bond and ask $500 cash bond.  He was fighting with the officers when taken into custody.  Under the criminal court he is an adult and once leave, he is a child.  Ask if his grandmother does not wish Mr. LaPean to go home, we set a JIPS or CHIPS and he should not be in jail and ask for signature bond.  This is a fault of the county and a child that would be homeless if his grandmother does not take him back and he be placed in jail is absurd.  I was unaware a 17 year old was in custody or I would have got something filed.  There is a 72 hour no contact that the department is asking be lifted.  Asking for a signature bond in this matter.  Court wants to hear from the State if wishing for no contact with this victim.  Attorney Seifert has not talked to victim and will not ask for a no contact.  Court wants to hear from the victim on what the Court should do in this matter.  Do you wish no contact with Noah? J.B., guardian grandmother.  Noah lives with her.  Are you willing to have Noah have contact with you?  Yes I would.  I signed a waiver to have Noah have contact with her.  State would not object to a signature bond given Mr. LaPean's age.  Court will let you out of jail.  Refrain from possessing or consuming alcohol, controlled substances w/o physician's prescription; refrain from any abuse contact with your Grandmother Julie.  State also ask he comply with grandmother's house rules and allow her to report any deviation.  Mr. LaPean agrees his grandmother is his guardian.  Court incorporates into the signature bond:  adhere to all reasonable rules of conduct established by your guardian grandmother.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
